description: Property definitions for D&D 5e entity types

definitions.name: Weight
definitions.description: Weight of the item in pounds

definitions.name: Range
definitions.description: Weapon range (melee reach or ranged normal/long)

options.label: Ammunition
options.description: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon.

options.label: Finesse
options.description: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

options.label: Heavy
options.description: Small creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons.

options.label: Light
options.description: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.

options.label: Loading
options.description: Because of the time required to load this weapon, you can fire only one piece of ammunition from it when you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to fire it.

options.label: Reach
options.description: This weapon adds 5 feet to your reach when you attack with it.

options.label: Special
options.description: This weapon has special rules governing its use.

options.label: Thrown
options.description: If a weapon has the thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack.

options.label: Two-Handed
options.description: This weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.

options.label: Versatile
options.description: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the propertyâ€”the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.

definitions.name: Versatile Damage
definitions.description: Damage when wielded two-handed (versatile weapons only)

definitions.name: Additional Attack Bonus
definitions.description: Additional bonus to attack rolls (beyond magic bonus)

definitions.name: Dexterity Bonus
definitions.description: How Dexterity modifier applies to AC

definitions.name: Strength Requirement
definitions.description: Minimum Strength needed to wear without penalty

definitions.name: Stealth Disadvantage
definitions.description: Does this armor impose disadvantage on Stealth checks?

definitions.name: Recharge Formula
definitions.description: Dice formula for recharging (if recovery is 'formula')

definitions.name: Destroy When Empty
definitions.description: Is the item destroyed when all uses are consumed?

definitions.name: Effect
definitions.description: Primary effect of using this item

definitions.name: Healing Dice
definitions.description: Healing dice for potions of healing

definitions.name: Weight Capacity
definitions.description: Maximum weight the container can hold (in lbs)

definitions.name: Item Capacity
definitions.description: Maximum number of items (0 for unlimited)

definitions.name: Weight Multiplier
definitions.description: Multiplier for contents weight (e.g., 0.5 for Bag of Holding)

definitions.name: Spell Level
